intro: Arequipa australis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and dry climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense mats on the ground. Arequipa australis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in mountainous areas.
